title: Celebrate Spring With These Easter DIYs and Decor!
description: Adorable spring and Easter decorating ideas.Â Easy and cute ways to add some spring touches around the house with beautiful florals and decor.Â As much as I LOVE the fall season, there's something so special about the start of spring after a very cold and snowy winter.Â Our weather has felt more like summer around here lately, and it has me in the mood to clean up the garden beds and haul out the spring decor. I picked up a few new pieces and used some old ones to add some sweet touches around the house!This light and pretty decor has put us all in such a good mood! :)Â I found these cute bunnies in the Target dollar section this year:Â This post may containÂ affiliate links for yourÂ convenience.I may earn a small commission whenÂ you make a purchase through links.Â See myÂ policies and disclosure pageÂ for more information.Â Â Â Â They had smaller versions last year that are just as detailed.Â This trio of gold bunnies was a new find this season:Â I seem to like bunnies in a set of three. ;)Â I love their cute poses! They are bigger than the Target versions:Â There's also a set with really adorable Easter egg votive holders as well.Â I've had two fuzzy green bunnies on sticks from Pier One (RIP) years ago. I've never found a good spot for them, but this year I cut down the sticks and placed them in this greenery in our foyer:Read the full postThis content is property of Thrifty Decor Chick LLC. author: Thrifty Decor Chick
excerpt: Adorable spring and Easter decorating ideas. Easy and cute ways to add some spring touches around the house with beautiful florals and deco...
text: Adorable spring and Easter decorating ideas.Â Easy and cute ways to add some spring touches around the house with beautiful florals and decor.Â As much as I LOVE the fall season, there's something so special about the start of spring after a very cold and snowy winter.Â Our weather has felt more like summer around here lately, and it has me in the mood to clean up the garden beds and haul out the spring decor. I picked up a few new pieces and used some old ones to add some sweet touches around the house!This light and pretty decor has put us all in such a good mood! :)Â I found these cute bunnies in the Target dollar section this year:Â This post may containÂ affiliate links for yourÂ convenience.I may earn a small commission whenÂ you make a purchase through links.Â They had smaller versions last year that are just as detailed.Â I seem to like bunnies in a set of three. ;)Â I love their cute poses! They are bigger than the Target versions:Â I've had two fuzzy green bunnies on sticks from Pier One (RIP) years ago. I've never found a good spot for them, but this year I cut down the sticks and placed them in this greenery in our foyer:Too fun! They look like they're leaping through the grass. ðŸ˜‚I also found the most beautiful faux spring flowers! I ordered these ranunculus bundles a few weeks ago:They are SO beautiful...I absolutely love ranunculus flowers and these are so realistic. They're not quite as full as pictured online, but are just as pretty and detailed.Â Pretty sure these are the best faux flowers I've ever seen!I picked the dusty rose color. At first I had them in a small white vase on the mantel:Â But then I pulled out this sweet bunny vase and knew they'd look even better in there:Â SO CUTE.Â I also picked up this bundle of faux peonies -- they are 30 different color options available:Â Mine are a mix of light pink and dark purple called "New Sweetened Bean."Â They are arranged really well as they come -- in varying heights on the stems. But I prefer to arrange them on my own, so I separated them with a wire cutter:Â I've had this mint colored Easter egg vase for years, I can't remember where I picked this up. I love the color with these colors:Â It ties in beautifully with the sheer gauzy table runner in the color sage. I was so pleasantly surprised with this runner -- it's plenty long (10 feet!) and is SO soft.Â I would use it as a spring scarf if I wore them! :)Â The little bunnies from last year's dollar spot are hanging out around the flowers as a centerpiece:Â My friend Kim has an easy bunny ear napkin tutorial -- it took no time at all to put these together:Â I just love it!Â If you'd like something easier with an Easter theme, these ceramic bunny napkin rings are so sweet:Â Target has similar rings in their dollar spot! I just saw these yesterday:Â They don't have the gold inside the ears, but you could easily add a bit of paint if you like the look.Â I have a bunch of these little nests in my spring stash, and they are great on a table setting as well:Â I have a bunch of this crinkly paper filler that I use inside the nests.Â That paper made a cute little resting spot inside my mini terracotta pots as well:Â I've used both foam decorative eggs and these little bunnies -- they would make a great place card holder on your table as well.Â I don't leave the table settings out, but this little display will stay on the table throughout the spring. I think centerpieces are hard, but the simplest displays are always my favorites!This gorgeous peony wreath is one of my all time favorite finds for spring or summer. I grabbed it a few months ago with a Christmas gift card.Â I couldn't believe how beautiful it was when I pulled it out of the box:Â It is absolutely stunning! I wanted to put it out in January when I got it, but I held out. :)Â Here's a closer look at the flowers: Â I usually make my own wreaths for the seasons, so this was a lovey treat. It definitely brightens up our front porch!My final spring addition was the easiest by far, and also the corniest. But I LOVE IT. ðŸ˜‚Â The ears are wired so you can make them cute and floppy. I mean, come on! I just love them.Â By the way, I've had those topiary boxwoods on the porch 24/7 for nearly four years and they still look brand new!You could use any inexpensive bunny ear headbands, I bet the dollar store has plenty of options as well. Or make them with felt like I did for my DIY bunny wreath a few years ago.Â I like that these have wire inside so I can manipulate them a bit.Â Do you add any spring touches around the house this time of year? I don't do a whole lot, but what I do put out sure does brighten my mood! You can see all of my spring and Easter decor and DIYs here.
html:
Adorable spring and Easter decorating ideas.Â 

Easy and cute ways to add some spring touches around the house with beautiful florals and decor.Â 

As much as I LOVE the fall season, there's something so special about the start of spring after a very cold and snowy winter.Â 

Our weather has felt more like summer around here lately, and it has me in the mood to clean up the garden beds and haul out the spring decor. I picked up a few new pieces and used some old ones to add some sweet touches around the house!

This light and pretty decor has put us all in such a good mood! :)Â 

I found these cute bunnies in the Target dollar section this year:Â 

This post may containÂ affiliate links for yourÂ convenience.

I may earn a small commission whenÂ you make a purchase through links.Â 

They had smaller versions last year that are just as detailed.Â 

I seem to like bunnies in a set of three. ;)Â 

I love their cute poses! They are bigger than the Target versions:Â 

I've had two fuzzy green bunnies on sticks from Pier One (RIP) years ago. I've never found a good spot for them, but this year I cut down the sticks and placed them in this greenery in our foyer:

Too fun! They look like they're leaping through the grass. ðŸ˜‚

I also found the most beautiful faux spring flowers! I ordered these ranunculus bundles a few weeks ago:

They are SO beautiful...I absolutely love ranunculus flowers and these are so realistic. They're not quite as full as pictured online, but are just as pretty and detailed.Â 

Pretty sure these are the best faux flowers I've ever seen!

I picked the dusty rose color. At first I had them in a small white vase on the mantel:Â 

But then I pulled out this sweet bunny vase and knew they'd look even better in there:Â 

SO CUTE.Â 

I also picked up this bundle of faux peonies -- they are 30 different color options available:Â 

Mine are a mix of light pink and dark purple called "New Sweetened Bean."Â 

They are arranged really well as they come -- in varying heights on the stems. But I prefer to arrange them on my own, so I separated them with a wire cutter:Â 

I've had this mint colored Easter egg vase for years, I can't remember where I picked this up. I love the color with these colors:Â 

It ties in beautifully with the sheer gauzy table runner in the color sage. I was so pleasantly surprised with this runner -- it's plenty long (10 feet!) and is SO soft.Â 

I would use it as a spring scarf if I wore them! :)Â 

The little bunnies from last year's dollar spot are hanging out around the flowers as a centerpiece:Â 

My friend Kim has an easy bunny ear napkin tutorial -- it took no time at all to put these together:Â 

I just love it!Â 

If you'd like something easier with an Easter theme, these ceramic bunny napkin rings are so sweet:Â 

Target has similar rings in their dollar spot! I just saw these yesterday:Â 

They don't have the gold inside the ears, but you could easily add a bit of paint if you like the look.Â 

I have a bunch of these little nests in my spring stash, and they are great on a table setting as well:Â 

I have a bunch of this crinkly paper filler that I use inside the nests.Â 

That paper made a cute little resting spot inside my mini terracotta pots as well:Â 

I've used both foam decorative eggs and these little bunnies -- they would make a great place card holder on your table as well.Â 

I don't leave the table settings out, but this little display will stay on the table throughout the spring. I think centerpieces are hard, but the simplest displays are always my favorites!

This gorgeous peony wreath is one of my all time favorite finds for spring or summer. I grabbed it a few months ago with a Christmas gift card.Â 

I couldn't believe how beautiful it was when I pulled it out of the box:Â 

It is absolutely stunning! I wanted to put it out in January when I got it, but I held out. :)Â 

Here's a closer look at the flowers: Â 

I usually make my own wreaths for the seasons, so this was a lovey treat. It definitely brightens up our front porch!

My final spring addition was the easiest by far, and also the corniest. But I LOVE IT. ðŸ˜‚Â 


The ears are wired so you can make them cute and floppy. I mean, come on! I just love them.Â 

By the way, I've had those topiary boxwoods on the porch 24/7 for nearly four years and they still look brand new!

You could use any inexpensive bunny ear headbands, I bet the dollar store has plenty of options as well. Or make them with felt like I did for my DIY bunny wreath a few years ago.Â 

I like that these have wire inside so I can manipulate them a bit.Â 

Do you add any spring touches around the house this time of year? I don't do a whole lot, but what I do put out sure does brighten my mood! You can see all of my spring and Easter decor and DIYs here.Â
